title: Trump Threatens to Send National Guard to Chicago
description: "Balance of Power: Late Edition" focuses on the intersection of politics and global business. On today's show, Mary Lovely, Peterson Institute for International Economics Senior Fellow, discusses her takeaways from President Trump meeting with South Korean President Lee Jae Myung. Rep. Robin Kelly (D) Illinois shares why Chicago does not need the National Guard, and Nancy Tengler, Laffer Tengler Investments CEO & CIO, talks about President Trump taking equity stake in Intel and the impacts of his tariffs. (Source: Bloomberg)

This comes after the two nations agreed to a 15% trade deal between the two countries, and after a series of controversial developments in South Korea, including a recent spat with South Korea's President, who likened the situation to a "PerJURER REVOLUTION" and suggested that the US government could harm global business. Meanwhile, there are also new lawsuits filed by Elon Muskk against Apple and OpenAI, accusing them of injuring each other in a technological innovation competition.
